thread.title: Activewear parody video mocks women who wear exercise clothes for everyday activities |
thread.title_full: Activewear parody video mocks women who wear exercise clothes for everyday activities | The Courier-Mail

author: couriermail.com.au
title: Activewear parody video mocks women who wear exercise clothes for everyday activities |
text:
From coffee dates to catching the latest chick flick — decking yourself out in Lorna Jane has never been more acceptable. Cue the parody.
Activewear
Breaking a sweat ... NOT! Photo: Youtube/Skit Box Source: YouTube
A group of Sydney comics, Skit Box, have taken the internet world for a spin with their latest parody production — literally mocking ‘girls who wear activewear, to do not-active things.’
The 2 minute video takes viewers through a relatively normal day — grocery shopping, coffee catch ups and even a trip to the movies. But each and every woman is donned in colourful crop-tops, vibrant visors and slick sneakers — without actually getting ‘active.’
The clip kicks off with a woman walking down Manly beach and running in to a friend. ‘Are you going to the gym,” she asks. ‘No,’ she replies, ‘I’m just going shopping in my activewear.’
‘Going to the gym?’ No. Photo: Youtube/Skit Box Source: YouTube
The viral video has already raked up over 170,000 views on their Youtube channel
Hydrating in our activewear. Photo: Youtube/Skit Box Source: YouTube
The Truth About Exercise 48:29 Play video
Scientists are uncovering the new and surprising truths about what exercise is really doing to our bodies, and why we all respond to it differently.
Oovvuu 12 Aug 2015 TV/Science TV/Health TV/Society and Culture TV/Documentary Originally published as Parody video pokes fun at lazy women
